articles.author: JACK BROOK, STEPHEN SMITH and SARA CLINE
articles.description: NEW ORLEANS (AP) — The man responsible for the truck attack in New Orleans on New Year's Day that killed 14 people visited the city twice before and recorded video of the French Quarter with Meta smart glasses, an FBI official said Sunday.
articles.title: Man behind New Year's attack visited New Orleans before, recorded video with smart glasses, FBI says

articles.author: LISA MASCARO
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — As Congress convenes amid a winter storm to certify President-elect Donald Trump 's election, the legacy of Jan.
articles.title: Congress is ready to certify Trump's election win, but his Jan. 6 legacy hangs over the day

articles.author: WILL WEISSERT
articles.description: President Joe Biden is decrying what he calls an “unrelenting effort” to downplay a mob of Donald Trump supporters overrunning the U.S.
articles.title: Biden says Americans shouldn't forget Capitol attack -- but that there won't be a repeat this time

articles.author: TIA GOLDENBERG
articles.description: TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) — Gunmen opened fire on a bus carrying Israelis in the occupied West Bank on Monday, killing at least three people and wounding seven others. Violence has surged in the territory since Hamas’ Oct.
articles.title: Shooting attack on a bus carrying Israelis in the occupied West Bank kills 3

articles.author: KIM TONG-HYUNG
articles.description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — South Korea’s anti-corruption agency and police debated on Monday more forceful measures to detain impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol after their previous attempt was blocked by the presidential security service last week.
articles.title: South Korean anti-corruption agency and police debate tougher measures to detain impeached president

articles.author: KIM TONG-HYUNG
articles.description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — North Korea on Monday fired a ballistic missile that flew 1,100 kilometers (685 miles) before landing in waters between the Korean Peninsula and Japan, South Korea’s military said, extending its weapons testing weeks before Donald Trump returns as U.S.
articles.title: South Korea says North Korea fired a ballistic missile into the sea

articles.author: PATRICK WHITTLE and BRIAN WITTE
articles.description: A major winter blast of snow, ice, wind and plunging temperatures in the U.S. stirred dangerous travel conditions from central and southern states all the way to the East Coast early Monday, prompting schools and government offices in several states to close.
articles.title: Winter blast of snow, ice and bitter cold grips the US from the Midwest to the East Coast

articles.author: NICOLAS VAUX-MONTAGNY and SYLVIE CORBET
articles.description: PARIS (AP) — France’s former President Nicolas Sarkozy goes on trial Monday over alleged illegal financing of his 2007 presidential campaign by the government of late Libyan leader Moammar Gadhafi.
articles.title: France's former President Sarkozy standing trial over alleged campaign funding by Libya's Gadhafi

articles.author: MONIKA PRONCZUK
articles.description: OUAGADOUGOU, Burkina Faso (AP) — Their loved ones were slaughtered by Islamist extremists or government-affiliated fighters.
articles.title: They fled from extremists. Now the government in Burkina Faso tries to hide their existence

articles.author: JAKE COYLE
articles.description: Two wildly audacious films — Brady Corbet's 215-minute postwar epic “The Brutalist” and Jacques Audiard's Spanish language, genre-shifting trans musical “Emilia Perez” — won top honors at the 82nd Golden Globes on Sunday.
articles.title: 'The Brutalist,' 'Emilia Perez' triumph at Golden Globes
